text: dear friends I'm Rachna and I'm back

using ask okay now what are phrasal

they are followed by a preposition they
come together to form a mini phrase and
they entirely lose their meaning
independently alright so we're going to
take a look at phrasal verbs with asked
the first one asked after now you're
asked means to inquire okay but when it
comes with asked after it means to ask
about someone's well-being
okay so when you want some information
about someone you want to know how they
are doing how has life been for them
that means you are asking after them
please remember it is not literally you
know it does not mean literally that you
are asking after someone else's ask it

well-being just to see how life is going
for them okay so for example well I met
Mario yesterday and she was asking after

fine that means Maya was inquiring about
you that how life is going for you so
remember when you ask after someone you

one ask around now ask around means to
ask for help or information

asked them for chicken that means I
wanted to have chicken but they brought
me brief so when you ask for something
it means you want something okay so well
if you don't have a pen you ask your

meaning it means getting yourself into
trouble
